metadata.title: CVE-2022-34918 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.18.9. A typeconfusion bug in nft_set_elem_init (leading to a buffer overflow) could beused by a local attacker to escalate privileges, a different vulnerabilitythan CVE-2022-32250. (The attacker can obtain root access, but must startwith an unprivileged user namespace to obtain CAP_NET_ADMIN access.) Thiscan be fixed in nft_setelem_parse_data in net/netfilter/nf_tables_api.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34918` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-230-generic - 4.4.0-230.264~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-230-generic - 4.4.0-230.264~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-230-lowlatency - 4.4.0-230.264~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1110-aws - 4.4.0-1110.116
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1149-azure - 4.15.0-1149.164~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-230.264~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1110.116').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1149.164~14.04.1').
